text: they're fundamental questions that are
arising all the time like uh how do I
distribute my work and energy and
effort
uh every minute of the day you have to
face such questions sometimes there I
wouldn't exactly call it an ethical
dilemma but uh although I guess it is I
mean so for example in the early 60s I
had to make a really hard for me hard
decision should I start becoming really
active instead of just talking uh in um
critical human issues that were arising
then uh the war in Vietnam the growing
war in Vietnam Civil Rights Movement
many others so should I become really
active in those or should I devote my
time and energy to uh very exciting
intellectual work and to my growing
family I had little children uh well
that's a hard decision I knew perfectly
well that you can't just put your foot
in it and walk away if you get started
it's a growing commitment and my wife
and I had
to work that out in some fashion was not
simple in fact at one point uh she
actually had to go back to college after
years uh because it looked as though if
I might serve a long prison sentence we
had three kids to take care of well
there's decisions that's a serious
decision but there are lots of others
all the time
